Restaurants' common dining areas are not open to the public but drive-through, drive-in, take-away, and delivery are permitted. Remember to always practice social distancing, which means keeping 6 feet of space between you and others at all times. Restaurants' common dining areas will be closed from Tuesday, March 17 until May 1, 2020 unless changed under New Orders, also known as the Stay Home - Work Safe order, designed to slow the spread of COVID-19. See which restaurants are offering takeout or curbside service with Austin Takeout Tracker.Also, Meal on Wheels and More and the City of Austin will be distributing meals for curbside or parking lot pick up, with a limit of 10 meals per person. You must be registered, and they will have a limited number of meals to accept new clients. Learn about meal pick-up dates and locations. Learn more about essential activities and businesses under the order.

Childcare facilities that provide services to essential employees, such as healthcare workers are not impacted by the Stay Home-Work Safe Order.  

Childcare or daycare facilities must make sure they are following the social distancing requirements.  

Childcare must be carried out in stable groups of 10 or fewer (“stable” means that the same 10 or fewer children are in the same group each day).  

Children shall not change from one group to another. If more than one group of children is cared for at one facility, each group shall be in a separate room.  

Groups shall not mix with each other. Childcare providers shall remain with the same group of children.

Si su empleo se ha visto afectado por el coronavirus (COVID-19), solicite beneficios en línea en cualquier momento usando los Servicios de Desempleo o llamando al Centro de Llamadas de la Comisión de la Fuerza Laboral de Texas al 1-800-939-6631 de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. hora del centro. There are a lot of unknowns in the world right now. But one thing is certain, your emotional needs are important and if you are worried or upset, there is help. You may be feeling anxiety and worry, sleeping troubles, over or under eating, or sadness and depressed mood. If you have any of these symptoms, please reach out to:
  • Integral Care 24-Hour Crisis Hotline: 512-472-HELP (4357)
  • National Alliance for Mental Illness Helpline: 1-800-950-NAMI (6264) or text NAMI to 741741 from Monday-Friday 10:00 a.m.-6:00 p.m. ET
  • National Suicide Prevention Lifeline : 1-800-273-8255

While you are under isolation, you may need to access essential items such as groceries and medications. Several grocery stores are allowing seniors to shop in small numbers before opening up doors to everyone. Please check with your local grocery store for their current hours of operation.

Here is a list of other resources for seniors:

Family Eldercare has a phone program called Lifetime Connections Without Walls to help people 55 and older deal with social isolation. It provides social and educational sessions and will also have programs on COVID-19.

Age of Central Texas has resources on COVID-19 and has made a library of activities and resources online for older adults and caregivers who are quarantined at home. 

Drive a Senior provides free rides for seniors who sign up their service and schedule their rides ahead of time.Please contact the Drive a Senior partner serving your area.

Aging Services Council of Central Texas lists more services and volunteer opportunities on its website. Call them at 512-593-2269.

Meals on Wheels Central Texas delivers hot, nutritious meals to the elderly, disabled, and homebound in the Greater Austin area. Contact Meals on Wheels at (512) 476-6325.

Los Servicios de Alimentos del Distrito Escolar Independiente de Austin prepararán y proveerán comidas para los niños menores de 19 años y sus padres o personas que los cuidan en más de 70 localidades mientras las escuelas estén cerradas debido a las medidas de seguridad por el COVID-19. Las despensas locales de alimentos y los distritos escolares están proporcionando acceso a alimentos de emergencia en nuestra comunidad. Si necesita asistencia alimentaria, llame al 211 o visite Connect ATX Aquí le ofrecemos un mapa para ayudarle a encontrar comidas en su distrito. Para asistencia de bancos de alimentos y comidas, por favor haga clic aquí. También puede visitar el sitio web de la ciudad para más información.

Staff are teleworking and are available from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Monday through Friday via  fiscalsurety\@austintexas.gov to answer any questions, and provide instructions for submitting your fiscal deposit digitally.

A partir del 23 de marzo de 2020, las solicitudes de Exención del Plan de Sitio deben presentarse en formato digital. Para iniciar una Exención del Plan de Sitio, complete y firme la solicitud de Exención del Plan de Sitio y envíe un correo electrónico a daddac\@austintexas.gov. Si su envió incluye archivos grandes (más de 25MB), informe el personal en su correo electrónico y le proporcionarán más instrucciones para cargar esos archivos.

Effective March 23, 2020, DSD will accept Site Plan Correction applications only for changes to active site development permits with current fiscal posting. All corrections must be prepared and submitted as replacement sheets in a digital format. To initiate a Site Plan Correction, please complete and sign the Site Correction Request(PDF) and email the request to dsddac\@austintexas.gov

If your submittal includes large plan files (over 25 MB), please inform staff in your email and they will provide you with further instructions for uploading those files. For properties with site plans that have been completed and closed out, additional modifications or changes will need to be processed through the Site Plan Exemption process.
Please note:  Physical changes to record mylar permit sets are no longer required.
Please email  dsddac\@austintexas.gov. or use the Austin Build + Connect online portal (AB+C ).

La Ciudad de Austin define el distanciamiento social como quedarse y mantener una distancia mínima de seis pies de separación de las demás personas cuando les pasa por el lado de manera imprevista y por unos momentos.    El distanciamiento social no es aislamiento social. El distanciamiento físico es una parte esencial para evitar el contagio del COVID-19.    Los Centros para la Prevención y el Control de Enfermedades definen el distanciamiento social como una estrategia usada para ayudar a prevenir una pandemia generalizada de influenza. Los esfuerzos globales para combatir esta pandemia de influenza dependerán tanto en las intervenciones farmacéuticas como no farmacéuticas. Las medidas de control de infección comunitaria comprenden una variedad de estrategias que no son farmacéuticas y que están diseñadas para limitar la transmisión de la influenza pandémica. Estas medidas funcionan al reducir la oportunidad para que las personas entren en contacto con las personas infectadas y, por lo tanto, se propague el virus, reduciendo el número total de personas afectadas.

Actualmente no existe una vacuna para prevenir la enfermedad del coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19). La mejor manera de prevenir la enfermedad es evitar exponerse al virus. Se entiende que el virus se propaga principalmente de persona a persona, entre las personas que están en contacto cercano las unas con las otras (menos de 6 pies).

Puede protegerse a sí mismo tomando estas medidas: - Evite el contacto cercano con las personas que están enfermas. - Evite tocarse los ojos, la nariz y la boca con las manos sin lavar. - Lávese las manos a menudo con agua y jabón por al menos 20 segundos. Use un desinfectante para manos que contenga al menos 60% de alcohol, si no tiene agua y jabón disponibles.
Aprende más

Public gatherings are not allowed. All businesses and residents must stop on-site activities or work and stay home, except for essential businesses and activities. Everyone must follow social distancing requirements at all times.

All public and private gatherings of any number of people occurring outside a single household or dwelling unit is not allowed, except essential activities and essential work or members of a household or dwelling unit.

Caring for a family member, the elderly, minors, dependents, persons with disabilities, or other vulnerable persons in another household is considered an essential activity and is not impacted by the Stay Home - Work Safe order.
For more information: Work Safe Order

The City of Austin defines social distancing as remaining and managing a minimum of six feet of separation between people other than during incidental and momentary passing.

Social distancing is not social isolation. Physical distancing is a critical part of preventing the spread of COVID-19.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention defines social distancing as a strategy used to help prevent a widespread influenza pandemic. Global efforts to combat this influenza pandemic will rely on both pharmaceutical and non-pharmaceutical interventions. Community infection control measures comprise a variety of non-pharmaceutical strategies designed to limit the transmission of pandemic influenza. These measures work by reducing the opportunity for people to come in contact with infected persons and thus for the virus to spread, reducing the total number of persons affected.

Patients with COVID 19 have reportedly had mild to severe respiratory illness. Symptoms can include: 
    
●	Fever

Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a respiratory illness that is spreading from person to person. Learn more here about Coronavirus

A novel coronavirus is a new coronavirus that has not been previously identified. The virus causing COVID-19 is not the same as the coronaviruses that commonly circulate among humans and cause mild illness, like the common cold. Learn more about Novel Coronavirus

People  65 years or older, and/or people with disabilities, medical issues, like heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, cancer, or a weakened immune system, are at a higher risk for getting very sick from COVID 19.
Learn how you can help protect yourself if you are at higher risk of severe illness from COVID-19.

To minimize spread of the virus, please call 512-978-8775 rather than going directly to a clinic, urgent care or emergency department. Stay home and call 512-978-8775 for guidance if you have symptoms such as fever, cough, and/or difficulty breathing, and have been in close contact with a person known to have any of the symptoms above or has been diagnosed with COVID-19. Disminuir el acceso al estacionamiento es desalentar el hacinamiento en los parques. Además, el sendero para caminar y andar en bicicleta de Ann y Roy Butler en Lady Bird Lake se convertirá en un sendero "unidireccional" para aumentar la distancia física. Las donaciones se pueden dejar en la sede de ADRN / HOPE Family Thrift Store, 1122 East 51st Street, Austin 78723 de lunes a sábado de 10 a.m. a 6 p.m.

Usted puede salir a caminar. Simplemente deje un espacio de 6 pies o más entre usted y las demás personas en todo momento, y protéjase. En algunos lugares los senderos son muy estrechos para guardar una distancia de 6 pies, entonces de manera proactiva infórmeles a los demás amantes de la naturaleza antes de que se acerque mucho. Si ve a las personas acercándose mucho y no obedeciendo los requisitos de distanciamiento social, encuentre otro lugar para caminar.

You can also get the latest news here.

Con el objeto de retrasar aún más la propagación del COVID-19, el condado de Austin-Travis ha implementado una recomendación para el público general de usar cubiertas para la cara de tela al llevar a cabo actividades esenciales o negocios esenciales fuera de su residencia.

Las bufandas o bandanas son artículos comunes del hogar que fácilmente funcionan como una cubierta para la cara. También hay muchísimos patrones para hacer las mascarillas usted mismo, incluyendo guías de los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades (CDC, en inglés) y guías de Salud Pública de Austin (APH).
